data.title: Strategy unlikely to acquire its Bitcoin-buying rivals as it’s ‘too risky’- Michael Saylor
data.description:
Strategy CEO Michael Saylor says the firm has no plans for mergers or acquisitions, calling them risky and distracting.
source: https://www.cryptopolitan.com/strategy-unlikely-acquire-bitcoin-buy-rivals/

data.title: Record Outflows in Gold Funds Amid Varied Investment Inflows
data.description: According to Foresight News, Bank of America, citing EPFR data, reported significant financial movements in the week leading up to Wednesday. Stock funds saw an inflow of $17.2 billion, while bond funds attracted $17 billion. Cash inflows reached $36.5 billion, and cryptocurrency investments increased by $600 million. In contrast, gold funds experienced a record outflow of $7.5 billion.

data.title: Aster Token Surges Following Buyback Announcement
data.description: According to BlockBeats, Aster's token experienced a brief surge of over 6%, raising its market capitalization to $1.935 billion. This increase is attributed to the announcement that Aster will destroy 50% of the tokens in its buyback address.

data.title: US Inflation Stat Faces Chaos as Government Shutdown Freezes BLS Data
data.description:
If you’ve been watching crypto news today, you probably felt the sting of this Halloween crypto crash. Bitcoin price has slipped below $108K before slowly climbing back now. ETH USD is falling from the $4K line, and people are wondering if “Uptober” has officially been cancelled. It’s rough out there,. . .
source: https://99bitcoins.com/news/bitcoin-btc/us-inflation-stat-faces-chaos-as-government-shutdown-freezes-bls-data/

data.title: Bitcoin White Paper Celebrates 17th Anniversary, Marking Blockchain Era's Beginning
data.description: According to PANews, today marks the 17th anniversary of the release of the Bitcoin white paper. On October 31, 2008, Satoshi Nakamoto published a paper titled "Bitcoin: A Peer-to-Peer Electronic Cash System" on a cryptography mailing list, introducing the concept of a decentralized electronic cash system. This paper laid the technical and ideological foundation for Bitcoin and the entire cryptocurrency industry, signifying the start of the blockchain era.

data.title: Polymarket predicts that today's "League of Legends AL vs T1" match will generate over $12.6 million in trading volume.
data.description: Polymarket data shows that today's trading volume for the "League of Legends AL vs T1" match exceeded $12.6 million. With the score now AL 2:1 T1, the odds of betting on AL to win have risen to 75%.

data.title: ZEC decouples from BTC, prepares to break $400 range
data.description:
ZEC recovered to $380, decoupling from BTC. In the past year, ZEC has recovered in BTC terms, trading at levels not seen since the 2021 bull market.
source: https://www.cryptopolitan.com/zec-decouples-from-btc-prepares-to-break-400-range/

data.title: IQ partners with FRAX to launch KRWQ, a stablecoin pegged to the Korean won.
data.description: Web3 infrastructure company IQ announced a partnership with FRAX to launch KRWQ, a stablecoin pegged to the Korean won (KRW). The stablecoin's issuance complies with South Korean stablecoin regulations and is primarily intended for payments and liquidity management in decentralized finance (DeFi). It will not be sold or promoted to individual investors within South Korea. Currently, KRWQ is listed on Coinbase's Ethereum Layer 2 network Base, and the decentralized exchange Aerodrome will simultaneously open a KRWQ-USDC trading pair and establish a liquidity pool. BrainDAO, which manages approximately $40 million in assets, stated that it will gradually increase liquidity supply based on market demand. LayerZero will also support cross-chain transfers of KRWQ and provide integrated liquidity through its OFT token standard and the Stargate bridging protocol. (Korea Economic Daily)

data.title: Aster announced it will burn 50% of its buyback tokens.
data.description: Aster announced on the X platform that it will improve the S3 buyback and airdrop model to enhance the token economy. 50% of all buyback tokens (including S2 and S3) in the public buyback address will be burned, and the remaining 50% will be returned to the locked airdrop address.

data.title: New York judge grants relief to Multichain liquidators, extending freeze on stolen USDC
data.description:
The Singapore liquidators are seeking to recover assets stolen from Multichain, including $63 million worth of USDC.
source: https://www.theblock.co/post/377094/multichain-extends-freeze-stolen-usdc?utm_source=rss&utm_medium=rss

data.title: Ave.ai officially launches on-chain perpetual contract functionality.
data.description: On October 31st, according to official news, multi-chain aggregation trading platform Ave.ai announced its official integration with edgeX's PerpDEX system, launching a new on-chain perpetual contract trading function. This function is already available in the latest version of the Ave.ai Android app, with iOS and web versions to be supported in subsequent versions. This upgrade marks Ave.ai's transition from a multi-chain aggregation spot platform to a stage of "integrated spot + contract trading, 100% on-chain execution." Through deep integration with edgeX, the platform achieves low-latency matching, high security, and efficient cross-chain interaction under a decentralized architecture, further enhancing the on-chain trading experience and market liquidity. Key features include on-chain matching and settlement mechanisms based on edgeX PerpDEX, deeper multi-chain liquidity aggregation, fully decentralized execution, and AI-driven transaction analysis support. Ave.ai stated that this expansion is a significant milestone in building its full-chain trading infrastructure, and it will continue to integrate smart contracts and cross-chain data analysis to create a more complete decentralized trading ecosystem.

data.title: Radiant Capital Hacker Transfers Over 5,400 ETH to Tornado Cash
data.description: According to Odaily, PeckShield has reported that a hacker associated with Radiant Capital has transferred 5,411.8 ETH into Tornado Cash. The value of this transaction is approximately $20.7 million.

data.title: A New York court granted Multichain's liquidators' request to extend the freeze on the stolen USDC addresses.
data.description: A New York court has granted a request for interim relief from Circle, the Singapore-based liquidator representing the Multichain Foundation, ordering the company to continue freezing three wallet addresses involved in the hacking attack until further notice. This measure will prevent the transfer of USDC from these wallets. According to court documents, Circle implemented the freeze by adding the relevant addresses to a blacklist mechanism within the USDC smart contract. Multichain suffered a $210 million cross-chain bridge attack in July 2023, which included the theft of approximately $63 million in USDC. Earlier this year, Multichain entered liquidation proceedings in Singapore to recover the stolen assets. The court believes this interim relief is an effective mechanism for maintaining asset security in cross-border bankruptcy cases and helps promote judicial cooperation between the US and foreign courts. Previously, the US Department of Justice had requested Circle to freeze the addresses involved but withdrew the seizure order due to its inability to confirm the hacker's identity. Separately, a group of US investors have filed a class-action lawsuit against Circle regarding the same batch of stolen USDC, and both parties have agreed to maintain the account freeze during the litigation process. (The Block)

data.title: Australian police crack coded wallet, seize $5.9M in crypto

data.title: New York court backs Singapore liquidators with extended freeze on Multichain assets
